snippet: An American businessman, Zack Shahin, has ended his seven-week hunger strike after the authorities agreed to set bail for his release at $1.4 million.
abstract: American Zack Shahin ends his seven-week hunger strike after authorities in Dubai agree to set bail for his release at $1.4 million; he was arrested in 2008 as part of an investigation into accusations of embezzlement and faced allegations of fiscal improprieties at his Dubai-based company.
lead_paragraph: An American businessman, Zack Shahin, has ended his seven-week hunger strike after the authorities agreed to set bail for his release at $1.4 million.

headline.main: United Arab Emirates: Officials Agree to Grant Bail for U.S. Businessman
headline.print_headline: United Arab Emirates: Officials Agree To Grant Bail for U.S. Businessman
